results.title: Christmas around the world. Yrs 1-4
results.brief_description: This program looks at Christmas customs in selected countries around the world. Highlights the origins of Christmas, St. Nicholas and other gift bearers, food festivities, and decorations.

results.title: Challenge of the trade
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke, George Cass and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Lucianne New follows the career of Dale Baker, principal dancer with the Australian Ballet including footage of Dale performing one of the leading roles in the popular musical “Cats”. Dale shares his thoughts on being male in a world of dance.

results.title: Cervical cancer
results.creator_credit: Russell Kightley, A Ralph Rosenthal and Health Education Video Unit, Leicestershire Health Authority
results.brief_description: Details the structure of the cervix and explains why it is particularly vulnerable to external agents. Addresses the high incidence of cervical cancer and recommends preventative strategies.

results.title: But what about spelling?
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan, Chris Tibballs, Julie Shepherd and Materials Production Dandenong School Support Centre
results.brief_description: A video to assist teachers with the development of balanced spelling programs. Spelling is seen as a problem solving process and the focus is on strategies for learning to spell within context rather than on rote learning of words.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vincent Donovan, Chris Tibballs, Julie Shepherd and Materials Production Dandenong School Support Centre

results.title: Beneath our feet. Parts 1-3
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: The Scenery of Victoria looks at the landforms throughout the state and relates the actual location to its geological significance. “Geological history of Victoria” Very similar to Part 1, but made for year 10 science with more emphasis on the period of history each geological type fits into. “Granite” looks at the formation and coding processes that produce granite with emphasis on the seven types of rocks that are currently associated with granite.

results.title: Arms race: where do we stand?
results.brief_description: Presented by Richard Morecroft, this thought-provoking program examines the important social issue of the arms race. Covers such topics as: the Maralinga tests, NATO and the Warsaw Pact, nuclear stockpiles, Australia’s defence forces policy, costs of war and the peace movement.

results.title: Anzac Day: World War 1 (Yrs 9-11)
results.brief_description: Presented by Richard Morecroft, this program looks at empire building alliances and events which led to the start of World War I. It presents the romance of war, life and death at Gallipoli and Australian campaigns in the Sinai desert and in Europe.

results.title: Language development in multicultural classroom: science
results.creator_credit: Lisa Milner and Sydney College of Advanced Education
results.brief_description: Focuses on how to develop specific language related to science for English as a second Language students. It shows how grade 3 and 4 explored a theme around a unit on Space, providing the viewers with both strategies and practical ideas.

results.title: Look & book: arts & entertainment video directory
results.creator_credit: Ron Cummings, Gary Gray, Irene Krumins and Raceplay
results.brief_description: A video catalogue of forty-five groups and artists who are available to perform at all types of venues including school functions and fetes. A wide range of performers are shown, covering such areas as: magic, mime, clowns, rock, country, folk and bush bands, cabaret, comedy, jazz and blues, guitars, piano and chamber orchestas, puppet theatre, dance and movement, vocal peformance and poetry.

results.title: We don't make him special
results.creator_credit: Peter Brighton, Joan Reidy, Marjorie Fisher and I E A
results.brief_description: The story of the integration into life’s normal activities of a Down’s syndrome child as related by his mother. The acceptance of the child into the school community is effectively portrayed enabling the program to be utilised by a school contemplating the integration of disabled students. A positive program that supports the belief that the whole community benefits from the integration of disabled people into society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Brighton, Joan Reidy, Marjorie Fisher and I E A
